definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]

sentences.english: In 1814, Malta became a part of the British Empire.
sentences.chinese: 1814年，马耳他岛沦为大英帝国的殖民地。

sentences.english: The sun that shone on the British empire had passed midday.
sentences.chinese: 照耀大英帝国的太阳已过晌午。

sentences.english: The british empire flourished in the19th century.
sentences.chinese: 大英帝国在19世纪很兴盛。

sentences.english: The entire island became part of the British Empire in 1815.
sentences.chinese: 整个岛屿在1815年成为大英帝国的一部分。

sentences.english: Roman empire, Brirish Empire all declined.
sentences.chinese: 罗马帝国，大英帝国都衰落了。
大英帝国是以新加坡为枢轴的。

sentences.english: Help influence world events, protect the UK.
sentences.chinese: 影响全球事件，保护大英帝国。

sentences.english: The Caribbean nation is a member of the Commonwealth, the association of countries that used to be part of the British empire.
sentences.chinese: 加勒比国是一个共和国，曾经隶属于大英帝国。

sentences.english: A. United Empire Loyalists and Métis.
sentences.chinese: 大英帝国的支持者和美提人。

sentences.english: The British Empire once took in a quarter of the world.
sentences.chinese: 大英帝国曾经吞占四分之一世界。

sentences.english: Those imperialistic English will be kicked out of the door, if they dare say it again.
sentences.chinese: 大英帝国将被我们踢走如果他们胆敢在这么说的话。

sentences.english: The British Empire once covered large parts of the world.
sentences.chinese: 大英帝国曾经占有过世界上的大片地方。

sentences.english: Ghosts of Empire: Britain’s Legacies in the Modern World. By Kwasi Kwarteng.
sentences.chinese: 在现代英国高度赞扬大英帝国是一种失礼。

sentences.english: The British Museum of London opened in 1759.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦大英帝国博物馆1759年开馆。

pinyin: Mei3 li4 jian1 He2 zhong4 guo2

definition: United Kingdom 聯合王國|联合王国[Lian2 he2 wang2 guo2]/United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland/abbr. for England 英格蘭|英格兰[Ying1 ge2 lan2]
